title: Blake family lawyer: AG Barr putting 'finger on the scale' to exonerate police
description: Benjamin Crump, the civil rights attorney representing Jacob Blake and his family, tells Rev. Al Sharpton that Attorney General Bill Barr is putting "his finger on the scales of justice" to exonerate the police in the shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha,
source.name: MSNBC

title: 'Women across the country are fired up': The fight for women voters in swing states

source.name: MSNBC

title: Inside QAnon, what is it and why its supporters are running for office
description: On Friday, Joe Biden was asked about QAnon, a far-right collection of conspiracy theories and its growing network of supporters.
source.name: MSNBC

title: RNC Adviser for Black Media Affairs: 'The president is having a successful time engaging with the Black community'
description: Rev. Al Sharpton is joined by Paris Dennard, RNC Adviser for Black Media Affairs. Dennard claims several polls mirror increased support from Black Americans - a Fox News poll suggests Trump garners just eight percent.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Militias, social media propaganda threaten election experts say
description: Social media disinformation, armed militias, and white supremacists threaten the 2020 election experts say. María Teresa Kumar and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: New Jersey beaches to stay open past Labor Day to make up for economic loss
description: NBC's Amanda Golden reports from Seaside Heights, N.J., where thousands gathered to celebrate Labor Day weekend. Local officials say they plan on keeping beaches open through the end of September to make up for the economic loss due to COVID-19.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Expert on autocracy sees similarities between Trump and Putin
description: Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin have similarities expert on autocrats Masha Gessen, author of ‘Surviving Autocracy,’ believes. Gessen tells María Teresa Kumar, ‘Anxiety is the autocrat's friend. I think #Trump got elected by speaking in larg…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Cohen book allegations discussed by Trump and politics experts
description: The Donald Trump allegations on the president’s actions and more made in Michael Cohen’s book are analyzed by politics experts, and experts on Trump’s history. María Teresa Kumar and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: New York grand jury to investigate as protests continue over death of Daniel Prude
description: The fourth night of unrest broke out in Rochester, N.Y., after video showing the death of Daniel Prude was released. New York's attorney general announced a grand jury being formed to investigate further, NBC's Kathy Park reports.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Pelosi: We don’t want vaccine on day sooner than it’s ready
description: Donald Trump’s alleged statements disparaging the members of the U.S. armed services, COVID-19 economic relief, the expected coronavirus vaccine, and more are discussed by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, in conversation with María Teresa Kumar.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: A New Jersey shore town is extending the summer season to make up for COVID economic losses
description: Crowds gather at the Jersey Shore’s beaches and boardwalks this Labor Day Weekend, despite COVID spike warnings. NBC’s Amanda Golden spoke with business owners in Seaside Heights who react to the town’s decision to keep their beaches open throughout September…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Reformed neo-Nazi explains how people fall prey to QAnon online
description: Shannon Foley-Martinez, a former violent white supremacist now working to extract others from extremist groups, says QAnon attracts people looking for a meaningful connection and a way to navigate a world that feels unsafe.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Mark Zuckerberg mentor on why Facebook refuses to curb disinformation: ‘It’s about power’
description: Roger McNamee, early Facebook investor and author of “Zucked: Waking Up to the Facebook Catastrophe,” says Mark Zuckerberg is too focused on “imposing his vision” to acknowledge the website’s threat to national security.
source.name: MSNBC

source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Ben Crump on Jacob Blake’s hospital message: 'His main concern has been about his children’
description: Jacob Blake delivered a message from his hospital bed after being shot in Kenosha, Wis., by a police officer. Family attorney Benjamin Crump tells NBC that Blake's main concern isn't about himself, but about his three sons.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rochester mayor moves crisis intervention out of police department
description: Rochester Mayor Warren announced that in the aftermath of Daniel Prude’s death in the custody of police, she will move the family crisis intervention team and its funding out of the police department and into youth and recreation services. Warren also said th…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Democrats and GOP offer opposing takes on reality experts say
description: Donald Trump’s GOP and the Democrats offer voters opposing takes on reality experts say, on topics such as race relations, fiscal spending, and more. María Teresa Kumar and her panel discuss how this may impact the 2020 election.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Harris reportedly amazes with appeal to Caribbean Florida voters
description: Florida voters of Caribbean descent are drawn to Sen. Kamala Harris, who is of Jamaican ancestry, experts say. María Teresa Kumar and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Gotcha: 'The NCAA has been playing man-to-man defense against the possibility of a union for years'
description: Rev. Al Sharpton rallies behind NCAA student athletes. Athletes are expected to perform at the collegiate level in the midst of a pandemic - for free.
source.name: MSNBC
